translation.en: [Jennifer] "Justice, like lightning Should ever appear
To some men hope And to other men fear."
My father taught me that poem when I was just a little girl.
translation.ko: 제가 어릴 때 아빠가 가르쳐준 시예요

translation.en: [man on TV] My son wasn't in no gang.
He had a job with the city and a little boy.
Our children are dying in these streets and no one cares.
No one is in control. Not even the police.
translation.ko: 경찰조차도 통제를 안 해요 "원 헌드레드 갱에 무고한 시민 또 희생"

translation.en: This city has really lost its damn mind. [sniffles]
This incident marks 125 shootings in Freeland in just one weekend,
proof The One Hundred keeps growing even stronger in power.
translation.ko: '원 헌드레드' 갱이 세력을 키우고 있단 증거죠

translation.en: Freeland activists took to the streets
to protest the notorious gang,
but it turned violent
when One Hundred gang members tried to break up the march.
translation.ko: 시위를 막으려 하며 폭력 사태가 번졌습니다

translation.en: [woman] They shootin'!
We understand the community is frustrated with the violence in our city.
translation.ko: 폭행 사건 때문에 예민해지신 점 이해합니다

translation.en: Freeland PD is frustrated, too. But I want to be clear,
we will not tolerate any rioting, looting, or violence. Excuse me.
translation.ko: 하지만 폭동, 약탈, 폭력은 절대 용인하지 않겠습니다

translation.en: But what about... One more question for you, Inspector--
[news anchor] Many residents say they have lost faith in the Freeland PD
translation.ko: 많은 주민이 경찰과 경무관에 신뢰를 잃었습니다

translation.en: and Inspector Henderson, a 23-year veteran
who came up through the ranks fighting Black Lightning,
who mysteriously disappeared nine years ago.
translation.ko: 블랙 라이트닝에 맞선 공로로 진급한 인물입니다

translation.en: One day, I wish these idiots would give us credit
for all the lives we've saved in Freeland.
[Jennifer] I didn't fully understand the poem
until I grew to know the truth about my family and myself.
translation.ko: 진실을 알기 전까진 시를 제대로 이해 못 했어요 언니가 해리엇 터브먼 행세하다 체포됐어

translation.en: The signs were always there, but this is how the journey began.
translation.ko: 징조는 예전부터 있었어요 하지만 그땐 몰랐죠 "수배-블랙 라이트닝 자경 혐의"

translation.en: Dad?
That's my dress.
Oh, yeah.
So is this one. Now, hurry up and put it on
before Dad gives birth to a small farm animal.
Oh, so you looked at your schedule for tonight...
and you had a choice.
Protest The One Hundred, or attend Garfield High's fundraiser,
translation.ko: 원 헌드레드 시위에 나가든가 가필드 고교 자선회에 가든가

translation.en: and you chose the path that led you to getting arrested.
It wasn't a choice, Dad.
No, it was a choice, Anissa. Everything is a choice.
translation.ko: 네가 선택한 거야, 아니사 세상에 안 그런 일은 없어

translation.en: It was a peaceful protest.
Oh, yeah, burning police cars? Breaking windows?
translation.ko: 경찰차를 불태우는 게? 창문 때려 부수고?

translation.en: You know, that's actually the very definition of "peaceful."
Well, I guess it depends on what your definition of "peace" is.
Because the people in Freeland, they haven't had peace in generations.
translation.ko: 프리랜드에선 평화란 게 없어진 지 오래잖아요

translation.en: "Returning violence for violence multiplies violence,
adding deeper darkness to a night already devoid of stars."
translation.ko: '별이 사라진 하늘을 더욱 어둡게 할 뿐'

translation.en: Dr. King.
"And I'm sick and tired of being sick and tired."
translation.ko: '난 이제 아프고 힘든 건 못 참겠다'

translation.en: -Fannie Lou Hamer. -Yep.
-But that is not the point I'm making. -[police siren blaring]
This night just keeps getting better and better.
[dispatcher] To be advised, the suspect is armed.
[Anissa] Dad, what's going on?
-Copy that, Dispatch... -[Jefferson] Just be calm.
-Ugh! -[Jefferson] Let me handle this.
Yeah, this doesn't feel so good, does it?
[Jefferson] Jennifer.
Step out of the car.
Look, Officer, my name is Jefferson Pierce--
Get out, please.
Okay, okay, look, this is getting out of hand.
Now, this is the third time this month!
-[Jennifer] Hey! -What are you doing?
Get your hands off my dad!
-Hey! -Leave him alone!
-Let me see your hands! Now! -[Jefferson] Stop!
Don't shoot, all right? Everybody, just calm down!
Okay.
[officer] Ma'am, put 'em up on the dashboard.
Anissa, put your hands on the dashboard!
Dad, I have the right to videotape if I want to!
Damn it, Anissa, just do it now!
[officer] Is this the guy?
You're not gonna tell me what this is all about?
You have a good night, sir.
I asked you a question.
Her liquor store just got robbed.
[stutters] And I'm sure the description is what,
"a black man dressed in a suit and tie"?
"Getaway car, a mid-sized Volvo wagon"?
[scoffs] You have a good night, sir.
[Jennifer] This was the night, in the rain,
with thunder and lightning as a witness, that Black Lightning was born again.
translation.ko: 천둥 번개를 증인으로 블랙 라이트닝이 다시 태어났죠

translation.en: We all know that this city is in a crisis.
translation.ko: 우리 도시가 위기란 건 다들 알 거예요

translation.en: But under the leadership of Principal Jefferson Pierce,
Garfield High is an oasis of hope.
translation.ko: 가필드 고교는 희망의 샘으로 남을 겁니다

translation.en: This Olympic gold medal-winner came back
to his old neighborhood of Freeland to turn it around.
And with graduation rates now in the 90s,
Jefferson does it all with the help of an outstanding faculty and his family.
His oldest daughter, Anissa, is a medical school student,
and teaches three days a week at the school as a health educator.
His younger daughter, Jennifer,
is a standout scholar-athlete just like her father.
-Girl, I was about to leave your ass. -[scoffs] Okay.
No. Ain't nobody got time to be waiting on the Queen Of Garfield High.
translation.ko: 누가 가필드 고교 여왕님 시중을 들어 준다고

translation.en: Kiesha, stop calling me that.
What? Girl, embrace it. It's true.
Yeah, but when people say it, they're just low-key hating on me
translation.ko: 애들은 날 은근히 싫어해서 그렇게 부르는 거잖아

translation.en: for something I can't control. Like, my dad's the principal, I get it.
translation.ko: 우리 아빠가 교장인 걸 나보고 어떡하라고

translation.en: Girl, here you are. Where do y'all think y'all going?
[groans] Okay, okay. Damn, we're busted. Um...
Listen, Khalil and a few of his friends were having a small house party,
and Kiesha and I were gonna go.
So why are your fast asses in the bathroom, half naked?
translation.ko: 그럼 왜 화장실에서 반은 벗고 있어?

translation.en: Thank you.
Listen, I promise to be home before Dad gets home.
translation.ko: 아빠 오기 전까지 집에 가면 되잖아

translation.en: Come on, Harriet, help a sister get some freedom.
You know what it's like to live in that house.
translation.ko: 그 집에서 사는 게 어떤지 알지?

translation.en: Please?
Listen, Jennifer, this fundraiser is over at ten o'clock.
You better have your behind in the house no later than 10:15.
-I'm not playing. -[giggles] Yep.
No, seriously.
-10:15. -Don't play with me.
I'm not playing, I promise. I'll be at home in the bed.
translation.ko: 그럼, 그 시간까지 침대에 쏙 들어가 있을게

translation.en: -Mmm-hmm. -Thank you. Thank you, thank you, thank you.
Love you. [chuckles]
And stop calling me "Harriet Tubman."
Oh, sorry...
Okay, come on, come on, hurry up.
Ladies and gentlemen, join me
and welcome to the stage, Principal Jefferson Pierce.
Thank you, Senator Turner.
Where is the future?
[students] Right here.
And whose life is this?
[students] Mine!
And what are you gonna do with it?
[students] Live it by any means necessary.
You wanna go over there? Come on.
-What do you say? -Are you serious?
Listen, don't think just 'cause I'm a little stoned
that means you're gonna get some.
Because I'm not having sex in a club bathroom
with somebody I just met. Or ever.
I was just playing.
No, you weren't. Because if I'd said yes, you would have been all over this.
Okay, all right, I'll give you that.
-That's wonderful. -That's great.
Excuse me.
You got a state senator introducing you?
Don't let all this high-class ass-kissing go to your head.
[laughs] Henderson, uh, my students would define your comments as "hatin'."
translation.ko: 헨더슨, 우리 학생들은 그걸 혐오 발언이라고 할걸

translation.en: -[laughs] -Thank you for your support.
And more importantly,
for pulling the strings to get Anissa released.
Of course. It's getting crazy out there, Jefferson.
The rules of the streets don't apply anymore.
[chuckles] You protest the police, we'll tear gas you, arrest you,
maybe even put a knot on your head.
But protest The One Hundred and they will kill you.
-[cell phone vibrates] -You tell Anissa she's needed more in emergency rooms than in those streets.
Got to get back to work.
And I'll check on those guys who pulled you over.
translation.ko: 자넬 잡아 세운 게 누군지도 알아볼게

translation.en: -I don't think they're mine. -Thank you.
Thank you.
Nice monkey suit.
You should start a church, Jefferson. At least you would make more money.
-[clears throat] -Enjoying yourself, Mr. Pierce?
I will if we hit our goal tonight.
-Well, turn on the charm. -[chuckles]
-[clears throat] -I have someone you should meet.
Ms. Lady Eve from Black Bird Funeral Parlor.
translation.ko: 블랙 버드 장례식장의 레이디 이브 씨예요

translation.en: Deep, deep pockets.
-Yeah, I met her once or twice. -Oh!
Okay, I will be over. Uh, just give me a minute.
-Hi. -Hey.
Heard your daughter got arrested tonight. It's not a good look, Jeff.
translation.ko: 당신 딸 체포됐었다며? 남들 보기에 안 좋아

translation.en: -My daughter? Oh, you're funny. -[chuckles]
Yeah, we have joint custody,
which means half of her attitude is your responsibility.
translation.ko: 그 애 태도의 반은 당신 책임이야

translation.en: Jeff, Anissa has not been in "our custody" for quite some time now.
translation.ko: 제프, 양육권 효력이 없어진 게 언젠데

translation.en: Now, I know it's hard for you to swallow, but she's not a child anymore.
translation.ko: 받아들이기 힘들겠지만 걘 이제 애가 아니야

translation.en: She's a grown woman.
Yeah, legally true, but emotionally and financially,
she is still in my care and always in my wallet.
translation.ko: 아직도 내 돈으로 먹고 사는 아기라고

translation.en: [chuckles] You know, I'm actually kind of proud of her.
She's a lot like you, Jeff.
Always wanting to help, always fighting for change.
translation.ko: 항상 누굴 도우려 하고 변화를 위해 싸우지

translation.en: You are beautiful.
Don't do that.
What?
You know what.
Besides, Ms. Fowdy's waiting on you.
You know, you actually look really good in this suit.
Hey, hey.
Hey, it's me.
No, I thought you said Jennifer was home.
What?
Absolutely ridiculous!
No, you should know better.
Yeah, I will talk to you later.
No, Afropunk over Coachella any day of the week.
-No way. -Are you serious?
SZA, Solange, Childish Gambino?
translation.ko: 스자, 솔란지 차일디시 감비노 들어봤어? "아니사: 어디야? 아빠가 알고 화나셨어!"

translation.en: All right, all right, I'll give you that one.
translation.ko: "아니사: 어디야? 아빠가 알고 화나셨어!" 알았어, 걔네 노랜 인정해

translation.en: So, you one of them alternative black girls?
[chuckles] All right, I'll take it.
No, for real, how old are you?
I'm serious, I'm 18.
What's good, bruh?
What up?
Uh, I'm gonna run to the restroom while you talk to your friends. Excuse me.
translation.ko: 친구들하고 얘기해 난 화장실 갔다 올게

translation.en: -No. -I'm sorry?
Chill. Chill.
[Lala] Well, well, well, well.
Why do I gotta chase you down to have a conversation?
translation.ko: 얘기 몇 마디 하자고 널 쫓아다녀야겠어?

translation.en: You ain't got to chase me down, Lala.
I'm just hustling,
just trying to make the money you say I owe you.
Oh, look, the money I say you owe me?
Bruh, did the Freeland PD
not steal 100 grand worth of product from you when you got popped?
See, none of this is my business. I'm gonna go. I'm just--
I'm talking, sweetheart. Just stand there and be cute.
'Cause I want to make sure that we clear on this point.
Did you not have commissary money?
Did you not have the best lawyer in Freeland?
translation.ko: 아니면 프리랜드 최고의 변호사를 안 구해줬냐?

translation.en: The money I say you owe me?
-I'm talking to you, man. -[grunts]
Why you got to do that in front of my girl?
You know I'm good for it. I'm gonna get you your money.
Don't say that. I'm not his girl. I just met him tonight, I swear--
translation.ko: 뭐래, 난 얘랑 오늘 처음 만난 사이야

translation.en: Hey, shut up. As a matter of fact,
I think your girl should start putting in some work
over at the Seahorse Motel to pay down some of that debt.
translation.ko: 시호스 모텔에서 빚 좀 갚게 해야겠다

translation.en: We good?
Yeah. Yeah, we're good.
We're good. [chuckles] With your proper ass, man.
No! No! The hell, we're not good.
I'm not ho-ing for nobody!
-I don't even know this dude! -Jen, Jen, I'm sorry. Wait.
You know what? I thought you were kind of cute
until I found out you were somebody's bitch.
Hey, man, I like this girl, man.
Whoa, whoa, whoa. Where you think you going, Bojangles?
No, please, let's not do this. I just need to get through that door.
translation.ko: 이러지 말자 난 저기 볼일이 있어

translation.en: You ain't getting up in here.
I tried to do it the right way.
Do you see him?
-Where'd he go? -Move! Move!
Right there!
Where'd he go?
Where you at?
[man] Come on! Come on! Hurry!
[officer on megaphone] You in the suit! Stay right where you are.
Put your hands where we can see 'em!
Do not move.
[slow echoing] Get on the ground!
He said, "Get on the ground!"
You get your black ass on the ground.
You are lucky you didn't get shot
or end up in some motel room right now, all drugged up and being passed around!
translation.ko: 총 맞거나 약에 절어서 몸 파는 신세가 될 뻔했다고

translation.en: All right, you're going too far with it.
No, I'm not. It's happening every day.
Plus, you lied to me.
You said you were going to a small house party, not Club 100.
Well, if I'd said Club 100, would you have still let me go?
-Uh, no. -Right.
Because your fast ass shouldn't be going there anyway.
translation.ko: 그런 데 가면 안 되니까 그렇지

translation.en: You know why they call it "Club 100," Jennifer?
Because that's all who hang there. Gang members.
Well, all you guys want me to do is go to school, run track,
translation.ko: 아빠랑 언니는 내가 달리기나 열심히 하면서

translation.en: and "set a good example for the other girls."
When did that become a bad thing?
I'm not Dad! I'm not you, and I'm not the Queen of Garfield.
translation.ko: 난 둘이랑은 달라! 가필드 여왕 되기 싫다고

translation.en: No, no, this is not about Dad or me
or some silly name they call you at school.
It's about the fact that you're trying to act grown when clearly you're not.
translation.ko: 네가 책임감도 없이 성인 행세를 하는 게 문제지

translation.en: Why are you being such a bitch right now?
Call me a bitch one more time.
I just won't tell you next time. How about that?
translation.ko: 다음엔 언니한테 말 안 할 거야

translation.en: You didn't tell me this time.
You came up in this house shaking because you were so scared.
translation.ko: 무서워서 덜덜 떨며 집에 들어오니까 알았지

translation.en: That's what told me. Now you want to act all cool
translation.ko: 지금 와서 경험 한번 했다는 식으로 굴면

translation.en: like it was just, what, some great adventure?
All right, I'm already stressed out.
-I can't with you right now. -Okay.
-Give me my phone, please. -Okay, you're not getting your phone.
Anissa.
[news anchor] Dark clothes. If anyone has any information...
I'm not here to talk about Club 100.
We are here because two police officers were viciously attacked tonight
while on the job protecting and serving this community,
translation.ko: 순찰 중이던 경찰관 둘이 심한 공격을 받았다기에

translation.en: plain and simple.
Witnesses say it looked a lot like Black Lightning was involved
at the incident at Club 100.
[Inspector Henderson] That's fake news...
This is not a game. This is real, Jen.
You all are really reaching, boy...
We are looking for a regular, human, black male,
who was probably hyped up on drugs.
This assailant is responsible for an attack
on two of Freeland's finest officers, not some freak...
-[grunts] -I thought you were done being a hero.
I am.
Doesn't look like it.
Thanks for stitching me up.
Luckily, it's just a flesh wound.
It doesn't feel like a flesh wound.
Nine years...
It has been nine years since I've even come close to using my powers.
And each of those nine years I've told you this city needs you. So what's next?
translation.ko: 난 9년 내내 자네가 나서야 한다고 했지, 어쩔 텐가?

translation.en: What? If you mean Black Lightning, there is no "next."
translation.ko: 뭘요? 블랙 라이트닝으로 나서는 일은 없을 거예요

translation.en: No, my daughter is safe.
Do you remember why you became Black Lightning?
You wanted to give the people hope.
You wanted the evil that's out there to have something to fear.
Right now there's nothing to fear
and evil's running rampant like a plague through this city,
hell, through this world.
[sighs] Okay. You know what?
Let's cut through the poetry and just talk real.
Now, the purpose of Black Lightning was to kill Tobias
translation.ko: 전 아버지 입에 기사더미를 쑤셔 넣어 죽게 한

translation.en: for literally shoving my father's articles down his throat until he died.
Then it was because of crime bosses, crooked politicians,
translation.ko: 그 후엔 범죄 조직 보스나 부패한 정치가 소탕

translation.en: every small-time street thug
that had snatched a purse or robbed a store.
You see, there's no end, Gambi.
There's no bottom for Black Lightning.
And the only loser in all of it is... me.
I feel like Lynn and I are making room for a possibility of a reconciliation.
translation.ko: 잘하면 린하고 재결합할 수 있을 것 같아요

translation.en: Do you hear me? I have a shot at putting my family back together.
translation.ko: 다시 한 가족이 될 수도 있다고요

translation.en: Black Lightning is not gonna jeopardize that.
translation.ko: 블랙 라이트닝이 돼서 그 기회를 망칠 순 없어요

translation.en: [clicks tongue] I love Lynn and those girls, but we knew this day would come.
translation.ko: 나도 린하고 애들이 좋지만 이런 날이 올 줄 알았잖아

translation.en: Jefferson, I've known you since you were 12 years old.
You're like my son, so I have to tell you the truth.
The promise you made Lynn was well-intentioned,
but it always had an expiration date.
translation.ko: 그 약속은 결국 깨지게 되어 있었어

translation.en: [Lynn cries] Jeff, baby...
I can't do this anymore, Jeff.
I can't stay here with the girls and just watch you kill yourself.
I promise, no more.
See, that's a curious question. Why is he a vigilante
but other communities have folks with superpowers,
translation.ko: 다른 곳의 초능력자는 영웅 취급을 받는데

translation.en: and all of a sudden, they're heroes?
translation.ko: 왜 블랙 라이트닝은 자경 취급이냔 거죠

translation.en: This shows you how, in this country of nearly 400 years...
-Hey. -Hey.
...there's a double standard when it comes to us.
You know, I was just thinking about you on the drive over here.
What were you thinking?
Things you are not supposed to say -to your ex-wife. -[chuckles]
translation.ko: 전 아내한테 말하면 큰일 날 생각

translation.en: Everything okay?
Yeah. I just came over to calm Jennifer down.
She was pretty shaken up.
Why? What happened?
She was at Club 100 when that mess went down.
-She was there? -We tried calling you.
We even tried calling the school. [inhales deeply]
I think we've managed to calm ourselves down,
but it was scary hearing it, though.
Damn. The board had me hemmed up.
I mean, they're trying to...
It doesn't matter. It doesn't matter.
I tell you, these girls...
I mean, one of 'em gets arrested, the other's sneaking into clubs.
As scary and dangerous as it was, Jennifer was just being a teenager.
translation.ko: 심각하긴 하지만 그 나이 때 애들이 그렇지

translation.en: Don't take it personal and don't start having catastrophic thoughts.
translation.ko: 나쁜 의도는 없으니까 너무 걱정하지 마

translation.en: -Yeah, well, it's hard not to. -I agree.
When I think about what could have happened,
it makes me sick to my stomach.
Now she knows what can happen.
-You're right. You're right. -[chuckles]
Mmm, I better go.
Oh, and I played bad parent tonight. -You know, did the whole speech... -Mmm-hmm.
translation.ko: 내가 한바탕 설교하면서 나쁜 부모 역할 했어

translation.en: "You lied. You put yourself in danger.
This speaks to your character. No social media for a month."
translation.ko: '평소에 어떤지 알 만하다 한 달 동안 SNS 금지야'

translation.en: So you're good on that front.
translation.ko: 그러니 당신은 잔소리 안 해도 돼

translation.en: Wow. A month? You're not playing.
No. No, I'm not. Not when it comes to keeping them alive.
translation.ko: 물론이지, 애들 목숨이 걸려 있는 일인데

translation.en: Thank you.
So, I was watching the news tonight.
And they were talking about Black Lightning.
-[scoffs] What were they saying? -That he's back.
Is he?
Lynn, of course not. You know better than that.
I have saved more lives as a principal
than I ever would have as Black Lightning.
I'm not looking to go backwards.
I pray that's true.
It is.
Good. 'Cause I don't ever wanna see you like that again. Ever.
translation.ko: 당신 또 다치는 거 보고 싶지 않아

translation.en: It was too painful.
You are talking like someone who cares about me.
I do care about you, Jeff.
I do.
You're not gonna find anything.
Just a man who wants his woman back.
translation.ko: 사랑을 되찾고 싶은 남자가 있을 뿐이지

translation.en: I should go.
Yeah.
-Drive safe. -[car lock chirps]
Daddy, why are you bleeding so much?
translation.ko: 아빠, 왜 그렇게 피가 많이 나요?

translation.en: [Lynn] You may as well be some crackhead.
I want you out. I want a divorce.
You broke your promise.
[Roland on TV] Look, you have this fervor, this desire for a savior,
and that speaks to how this system has utterly failed the black community.
translation.ko: 흑인 사회를 배척하는 시스템과 관련이 있죠

translation.en: Look, if Black Lightning is back, this is a game changer for Freeland.
[man] Tobias! Please! Don't do this! Tobias!
Hey, boss, you're gonna wanna come take a look at this.
translation.ko: 보스, 이리 와서 이것 좀 보세요

translation.en: [interviewer] Mr. Martin, is Black Lightning back?
Come on, what have you got?
You've got people praying for someone others call a vigilante
to be back in this city,
even though we haven't confirmed if this rumor is true.
What are you doing?
Dad, wait!
Stan, I have not heard from your parents.
-Have them call me. -Will do, sir.
So, that's what this is really all about, right?
-The board thinks-- -No.
The board wanting to put metal detectors in the school.
It's not about the metal--
Oh, Kay, I have the yearbook proofs in my office.
translation.ko: 케이, 사무실로 졸업 앨범 확인하러 와

translation.en: -Come find me. -All right.
Jefferson, it's not about the metal detectors,
it's about the safety of the students.
-"The safety of the students"? -Yes.
Is that what they told you?
No, look...
Now, I will not treat my students like criminals.
translation.ko: 우리 학생을 범죄자 취급할 순 없어요

translation.en: Do you realize almost all of these kids know someone in prison?
translation.ko: 학생 대부분이 감옥에 지인이 있다는 거 알아요?

translation.en: Yeah, their mothers, or fathers, or their aunties, uncles.
Now I will not turn my school into another jail, Kara.
translation.ko: 학교를 감옥으로 만들 생각은 없어요, 케라

translation.en: I'll relay the message.
Thank you.
[chuckles] You really don't quit, do you, old man?
translation.ko: "좋은 일도 많이 했어 링크" 이 양반은 질리지도 않나

translation.en: When you're staring down the barrel of a gun,
translation.ko: "블랙 라이트닝이 구출한 가게 주인" 총에 맞아 죽게 생겼을 땐

translation.en: you don't care if the person saving you is a Christian, Muslim, Jew,
translation.ko: 누가 구해주든 상관없죠 기독교, 무슬림, 유태교

translation.en: black or white, or some guy in a weird Parliament-Funkadelic getup.
translation.ko: 흑인, 백인, 웬 이상한 펑크 그룹이든 간에요

translation.en: -"Parliament"? -You just wanna be saved.
-[robber] Hurry up, man! -Here it is.
I've watched this every year on my birthday since then.
I wouldn't have seen my kids graduate college,
the first black President,
or my grandkids if it wasn't for Black Lightning.
translation.ko: 손주를 볼 수 있었던 건 다 블랙 라이트닝 덕분이죠

translation.en: What are you even doing here?
Jennifer, damn, girl, come on!
I told you, I just wanna make sure we were cool.
translation.ko: 서로 맘 상한 채면 좀 그렇잖아

translation.en: Look, I saw your Instagram and I zoomed in on your initials
and you know, I found you.
Okay, one, that's called "stalking." And second, it's creepy.
-Now get out of here, I'm serious. -No, it's not! Yo, Jen--
Stop! What the hell is wrong with you? Get your hands off me!
translation.ko: 그만해! 대체 왜 이래? 잡지 마!

translation.en: Damn! Why do black girls gotta have so much attitude?
translation.ko: 젠장! 흑인 여자애들은 왜 이리 드세?

translation.en: What the hell is wrong with you, grabbing on her like that?
You need to get up out my face.
You are not a student here
and I'm asking you to leave before I call the police.
Bitch, I told you to get out of my face.
That's it. I'm calling the police.
The hell you not.
-[Anissa] Let's go now. Let's go. -Whoa. Whoa, whoa, whoa!
Now what happens after you pull this gun?
You going to shoot her? In front of the entire school?
You're on parole, right?
Yeah, yeah. There are cameras all over this place.
translation.ko: 여긴 감시 카메라가 사방에 달려 있어

translation.en: Do you really wanna go back to jail for a school shooting?
translation.ko: 학교 총기 사건으로 또 감옥에 가고 싶어?

translation.en: 'Cause that is life with no possibility of getting out.
You don't know who you're messing with.
You're right, I don't.
But the police are already on their way and they don't care who you are.
translation.ko: 하지만 지금 오는 경찰은 네가 누구든 신경 안 써

translation.en: They will shoot your black ass for fun.
This ain't over. Bet that.
[Jefferson] What the hell were you thinking?
I mean, you not only put yourselves in danger,
but also the entire school.
What was I supposed to do?
You were supposed to follow school protocol,
call security, and walk away.
It's been seven years since I took over as principal.
Seven years, and we haven't had one incident of violence.
translation.ko: 7년간 단 한 번도 폭력 사건이 없었어

translation.en: Not one. And now this.
If you haven't noticed, Dad, violence is everywhere in Freeland.
Did you really think it wasn't gonna touch Garfield at some point?
Either we help the community as a whole or we will all go down in pieces.
translation.ko: 사회 전체를 일으키지 않으면 차례대로 무너질 뿐이에요

translation.en: No. No, this is not about one of your political diatribes right now.
translation.ko: 지금 정치 얘기 하자는 게 아니잖아

translation.en: It's not about the community. A community, I might remind you,
translation.ko: 사회 얘기도 아니고 사회 하니까 말인데

translation.en: I've been fighting for since before you were born.
translation.ko: 난 네가 태어나기도 전부터 싸워온 사람이야

translation.en: This is about me trying to keep my daughters alive. Period.
translation.ko: 지금 아빠 걱정은 딸 둘을 지키는 거야

translation.en: What happened, Dad?
When did you abandon your people?
Love you. Anissa.
Mr. Jefferson.
Latavious.
Wow. "Latavious."
Nobody's called me that since I graduated from Garfield.
I'm kinda busy, so let's jump right in.
I heard what happened with Will. Not cool, especially at the school.
translation.ko: 윌 얘기 들었어요 학교에서 그런 일이 생기다니

translation.en: Yes, exactly.
Now I've had an unwritten agreement for years with all the gangs.
Garfield is a safe zone, right? He broke that.
translation.ko: 몇 년째 이어진 그 약속을 녀석이 깨버렸어

translation.en: Now I'm trying not to drag the police into this
because I do not want things to escalate.
But I need you to keep Will away from my girls,
and away from Garfield.
Will's my cousin.
He's been kinda lost since he got out of jail.
translation.ko: 감옥에서 나온 후로 애가 좀 힘들어해요

translation.en: But you ain't trying to hear all that. I get it.
translation.ko: 물론 이 말 들으려고 오신 건 아니겠죠

translation.en: Hey, come here.
You late. The van's gone already.
This is Mr. Jefferson. I went to his school.
translation.ko: 제퍼슨 선생님께 인사해 날 가르치신 분이셔

translation.en: Hey.
Come on, man. You know that's not how we do.
Look at Mr. Jefferson in the eyes.
Shake his hand and introduce yourself.
Hey, Mr. Jefferson. My name's Malik. It's a pleasure to meet you.
It's a pleasure to meet you, too.
Whoo! That's what I'm talking about. Yeah. Everything okay?
-Yeah, everything's cool. -Excellent.
-[gasps] -Latavious.
'Cause I was told that you spent most of yesterday
playing video games in your phone.
What pisses me off is when you don't give it your best, Malik.
translation.ko: 내 불만은 네가 최선을 다하지 않는단 거야

translation.en: When you don't put in -the effort to succeed. -Ow.
There's a time to play games and there's a time to focus on reality.
translation.ko: 게임할 시간이 있고 현실에 집중할 시간이 있는 거야

translation.en: And the reality of the situation is...
Latavious...
While you got your mind buried in them video games,
them white boys up in them neighborhoods that you selling in
are being prepared to run the world and your black ass!
Okay, Latavious, that is enough!
You know my damn name!
Now say it.
Say it.
Lala.
Never put your hands on me again.
You teach them your way and I teach them mine.
Give me your phone.
Go get that broom. I want these floors swept.
translation.ko: 빗자루 갖고 와서 여기 바닥 쓸어

translation.en: And don't even ask me about your damn phone.
I'mma do you this favor.
But that means you owe me.
We good?
We good.
That's a nice suit, man.
Real nice suit.
All right, ladies. Homework. Let me--
Excuse me? I'm talking to you.
-[Will] Remember me? -I'm not afraid of The One Hundred.
translation.ko: - 나 기억해? - 난 갱 안 무서워

translation.en: -Bitch, you should be! -Get your hands off of her!
translation.ko: - 무서운 줄 알아야지 - 그 손 치워!

translation.en: Let's go. Come on!
-Jen! -Anissa.
Don't! Wait, don't take them!
This could literally turn into a mess if we're not careful, Lynn.
Now, let me at least confirm
that they're at the Seahorse Motel before we go in.
How long does "confirm" take, Henderson?
We're talking about our daughters here. Our daughters.
I should just go over there and talk to someone my damn self.
translation.ko: 그냥 내가 직접 가서 얘기하는 게 낫겠어

translation.en: Talk to who?
Who, Jeff?
We're at this point right now 'cause you didn't talk to me in the first place.
translation.ko: 애초에 경찰에 연락했으면 이런 일 없었잖아

translation.en: I'm sorry.
It's not your fault.
Now, come on, man, let me take care of it. Let me do my job.
translation.ko: 나한테 믿고 맡겨 이건 내 일이잖아

translation.en: Okay.
Okay.
Jeff, where are you going?
To get our girls.
Bring them home.
The One Hundred have Jennifer and Anissa.
Head downstairs.
I've been working on something new.
Something better.
So your dumb ass thought
that bringing them here was actually a good idea?
translation.ko: 얘넬 데려오면 잘했다고 할 줄 알았어?

translation.en: Yes!
These ain't no ordinary girls, man!
Their father's like Black Jesus to Freeland!
translation.ko: 프리랜드에 있어서 예수 같은 분의 딸이라고!

translation.en: You know damn well
that you don't make a move like this without permission.
translation.ko: 이런 행동 하면 안 된다는 거 알 텐데

translation.en: No, I was just trying to--
See what I mean? It's been, like, what, huh,
translation.ko: 내 뜻 알겠어? 내가 여기 굴린 지

translation.en: at least five years since I took over this place,
and we ain't had no violence here? Now look.
translation.ko: 누구 칠 일이 없었는데 이게 무슨 꼴이냐?

translation.en: Handle that.
-Murk these girls and make them disappear. -[crying]
And you do the same.
Nice suit.
Now you should at least give a brother a moment
to say something heroically clever.
Now you've just pissed me off.
Let's go, Jen!
-Where is Lala? -I don't know!
Boy!
Now, I'm only gonna ask you one more time.
Where's Lala?
[sobs] I don't know, man!
Is that your car?
Yeah.
It was nice.
[officer] Get over here! Move! Move!
They were holding us in that room up there. Right there!
-Hey, boss, you know, I-- -[shushing]
Damn!
Do you believe in the Resurrection, Latavious?
-I asked you a question. -[continues groaning]
Do you believe in the Resurrection?
The concept itself is beautiful, but it's a complete fantasy.
I killed Black Lightning.
-[groaning] -But it seems you and whoever this is
have developed an adversarial relationship that's bad for my business.
translation.ko: 너랑 적대 관계가 되면서 내 사업에 지장이 가는데

translation.en: My question is, can you take care of this problem,
or should I just kill you now and solve it myself?
translation.ko: 아니면 널 죽이고 내가 직접 처리할까?

translation.en: It's okay. It's okay, you're okay.
Thank you.
You're welcome.
But it's not over yet.
of The One Hundred!
[Will echoing] Bitch, you should be!
[Lala] Murk these girls and make them disappear.
[Will] It's that Black Lightning dude?
[Black Lightning] Now you've just pissed me off!
[Lala] These ain't no ordinary girls, man!
